message.content:
cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NI 

This paper is about training deep convolutional neural networks (DCNNs) to achieve more brain-like representations, which can improve their performance on object recognition tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the development of representations in the hidden layers of DCNNs, which suggests a focus on neural networks and machine learning, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) likely sub-categories as well. Additionally, the paper proposes a new way to train object recognition networks using strategies in which the brain serves as a teacher signal, which falls under the scope of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper discusses neural recordings from monkey visual cortex, which suggests a focus on neuroscience and computational neuroscience, making cs.NI (Neuroscience and Neural Systems) a possible sub-category.
